H0.text: Perimysium is the middle layer of connective tissue.

H1.text: Tendon is the middle layer of connective tissue.

H2.text: Xerophyte is the middle layer of connective tissue.

H3.text: Pollenation is the middle layer of connective tissue.

A4.text: Endomysium combines with perimysium and epimysium to create the collagen fibers of tendons, providing the tissue connection between muscles and bones by indirect attachment.

A5.text: The whole tendon is enclosed by a fascia.
